resources.string: Located in Cairo, this hotel is just a few minutes’ walk from the Egyptian Museum, the Nile, and the Saddat metro station. It has a restaurant and a 24-hour front desk. Free Wi-Fi is available.

Don’t judge it by the dingy, claustrophobic lobby – rooms here are fine, with high ceilings, shiny tile floors, new bathrooms and good-quality mattresses. The sitting area has a beautiful terrace looking straight down Sharia Mahmoud Bassiouni.

Situated in Cairo in the Cairo Governate Region, 200 metres from The Egyptian Museum, Steigenberger El Tahrir features an outdoor pool and sauna. Guests can enjoy the on-site restaurant. Free WiFi is featured throughout the property.

The kitchen is right in front of you so you can watch the chefs at work, and service is friendly and efficient. The menu is nearly all pasta, with a few salads thrown in for good measure and with a rather delectable sweet-potato soup as a starter.
Egyptian street food gets a modern makeover. Zööba has taken the country\'s classic cheap eats and given them contemporary twists.
A little slice of the Continent, with loads of brass and mirrors, and friendly waiters in long white aprons, Maison Thomas has been serving up Cairo\'s best thin-crust pizza for decades.

The last remaining wonder of the ancient world; for nearly 4000 years, the extraordinary shape, impeccable geometry and sheer bulk of the Giza Pyramids have invited the obvious questions: \'How were we built, and why?\'.

One of the world\’s most important collections of ancient artifacts, the Egyptian Museum takes pride of place in Downtown Cairo, on the north side of Midan Tahrir.To walk around the museum is to embark on an adventure through time.

Founded in AD 970 as the centrepiece of the newly created Fatimid city. Al Azhar is one of Cairo\’s earlier mosques. The building is a harmonious blend of architectural styles, the result of numerous enlargements over more than 1000 years.
Sharia Al Azhar Islamic Cairo, Cairo

The skinny lanes of Khan Al Khalili are basically a medieval-style mall. This agglomeration of shops – many arranged around small courtyards – stocks everything from soap powder to semiprecious stones, not to mention tacky toy camels and alabaster pyramids.
off Sharia Al Azhar and Al Gamaliyya Islamic Cairo, Cairo

Bringing shopping, events, and hangouts together in the heart of New Cairo, Downtown Katameya is not just a mall, it is the ultimate hub for New Caireans. It is family friendly, and easily accessible with entrances on every side.
Area A-City Center, Road 90, Fifth Settlement, New Cairo
Arkan Mall Shopping and Retail in October 6, Al Jizah, Egypt
In front of 2000 Zayed City, 6th of October City, Cairo
